title: Repetitive Strain Injury Prevention Exercise Learning: Comparison of Multimodal Information Presentation Methods in K-12

context.prior_knowledge: General understanding of basic exercise physiology and preventive medicine
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers learning exercise methods to prevent repetitive strain injuries in real classrooms. Compares learning effectiveness based on information presentation formats in mobile microlearning environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the correct execution methods of repetitive strain injury (RSI) prevention exercises through various information presentation modes (text/images/videos).
Learners can demonstrate RSI prevention exercises with over 80% accuracy based on information provided in mobile environments.
Learners can evaluate the most effective instructional methods by comparing learning time, practice frequency, and performance outcomes across different information presentation formats.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
